Description: This registry contains the basic API response messages for the HPE RESTful API.

AccessDenied.Description: While attempting to access, connect to, or transfer to/from another resource, the service was denied access.
AccessDenied.Message: While attempting to establish a connection to %1, the service was denied access.
AccessDenied.Resolution: Verify that the URI is correct and that the service has the appropriate credentials.

AccountForSessionNoLongerExists.Description: The account for the current session is removed, and the current session is also removed.
AccountForSessionNoLongerExists.Message: The account for the current session is removed, and the current session is also removed.
AccountForSessionNoLongerExists.Resolution: Attempt to connect using a valid account.

AccountNotModified.Description: The request was unable to modify the account.
AccountNotModified.Message: The account modification request did not complete.
AccountNotModified.Resolution: If the operation did not complete, check the authorization or the request body for issues and resubmit the request.

ActionNotSupported.Description: The action supplied in the POST operation is not supported by the resource.
ActionNotSupported.Message: The action %1 is not supported by the resource.
ActionNotSupported.Resolution: The action was invalid or the wrong resource was the target. See the implementation documentation for assistance.

ActionParameterDuplicate.Description: The action was submitted with a duplicate parameter in the request body.
ActionParameterDuplicate.Message: The action %1 was submitted with more than one value for the parameter %2.
ActionParameterDuplicate.Resolution: Resubmit the action with only one instance of the parameter in the request body.

ActionParameterMissing.Description: The requested action is missing a parameter that is required to process the action.
ActionParameterMissing.Message: The action %1 requires that the parameter %2 be present in the request body.
ActionParameterMissing.Resolution: Resubmit the action with the required parameter in the request body.

ActionParameterNotSupported.Description: The action parameter is not supported on the target resource.
ActionParameterNotSupported.Message: The parameter %1 for the action %2 is not supported on the target resource.
ActionParameterNotSupported.Resolution: If the operation did not complete, remove the parameter and resubmit the request.

ActionParameterUnknown.Description: An action was submitted, but a supplied parameter did not match any of the known parameters.
ActionParameterUnknown.Message: The action %1 was submitted with the invalid parameter %2.
ActionParameterUnknown.Resolution: If the operation did not complete, correct the invalid parameter and resubmit the request.

ActionParameterValueFormatError.Description: The value type is correct, but the format is not supported or the size/length is exceeded.
ActionParameterValueFormatError.Message: The value %1 for the parameter %2 in the action %3 is in a format that is not supported by the parameter.
ActionParameterValueFormatError.Resolution: If the operation did not complete, correct the parameter value in the request body and resubmit the request.

ActionParameterValueTypeError.Description: The parameter contains an incorrect value type. For example, a number value for a string parameter type.
ActionParameterValueTypeError.Message: The value %1 for the parameter %2 in the action %3 is the incorrect parameter type.
ActionParameterValueTypeError.Resolution: If the operation did not complete, correct the parameter value in the request body and resubmit the request.

CouldNotEstablishConnection.Description: An attempt to access the resource, image, or file at the URI was unsuccessful because a session could not be established.
CouldNotEstablishConnection.Message: The service was unable to establish a connection with the URI %1.
CouldNotEstablishConnection.Resolution: Verify that the URI contains a valid and reachable node name, protocol information, and other URI components.

CreateFailedMissingReqProperties.Description: A create operation was attempted on a resource, but a required property was missing from the request.
CreateFailedMissingReqProperties.Message: The create operation did not complete because the required property %1 was missing from the request.
CreateFailedMissingReqProperties.Resolution: If the operation did not complete, include the required property with a valid value in the request body and resubmit the request.

CreateLimitReachedForResource.Resolution: If the operation did not complete, delete resources and resubmit the request.

Created.Description: The resource has been created successfully.
Created.Message: The resource has been created successfully.

EmptyJSON.Description: Indicates that the request body contained an empty JSON object when one or more properties are expected in the body.
EmptyJSON.Message: The request body submitted contained an empty JSON object and the service is unable to process it.
EmptyJSON.Resolution: Add properties in the JSON object and resubmit the request.

EventSubscriptionLimitExceeded.Description: The event subscription establishment has been requested, but the operation did not complete. The number of simultaneous subscriptions exceeded the maximum number allowed by the implementation.
EventSubscriptionLimitExceeded.Message: The event subscription did not complete because the number of simultaneous subscriptions exceeded the maximum number allowed by the implementation.
EventSubscriptionLimitExceeded.Resolution: Before attempting to establish the event subscription, reduce the number of subscriptions or increase the maximum number of simultaneous subscriptions allowed (if supported).

GeneralError.Description: Indicates that a general error has occurred.  Use in ExtendedInfo is discouraged.  When used in ExtendedInfo, implementations are expected to include a Resolution property with this error to indicate how to resolve the problem.
GeneralError.Message: A general error has occurred. See Resolution for information on how to resolve the error.

InsufficientPrivilege.Description: The account or credentials associated with the current session are not authorized to perform the requested operation.
InsufficientPrivilege.Message: The account or credentials associated with the current session are not authorized to perform the requested operation.
InsufficientPrivilege.Resolution: Retry the operation with an authorized account or credentials.

InternalError.Description: The request did not complete due to an unknown internal error, but the service is still operational.
InternalError.Message: The request failed due to an internal service error, but the service is still operational.
InternalError.Resolution: Resubmit the request. If the problem persists, consider resetting the service.

InvalidIndex.Message: The Index %1 is not a valid offset into the array.
InvalidIndex.Resolution: Verify the index value provided is within the bounds of the array.

InvalidObject.Message: The object at %1 is not valid.
InvalidObject.Resolution: If the operation did not complete, the object is malformed or the URI is incorrect. Make the appropriate corrections and resubmit the request.

InvalidURI.Description: Indicates that the operation encountered a URI that does not correspond to a valid resource.
InvalidURI.LongDescription: This message shall be used to indicate that the operation encountered a URI that does not correspond to a valid resource.
ArgLongDescriptions: This argument shall contain the invalid URI that was encountered.
InvalidURI.Resolution: Provide a valid URI and resubmit the request.

MalformedJSON.Description: The request body contains malformed JSON.
MalformedJSON.Message: The request body submitted is malformed JSON and cannot be parsed by the receiving service.
MalformedJSON.Resolution: Verify that the request body is valid JSON and resubmit the request.

NoOperation.Description: Indicates that the requested operation will not perform any changes on the service.
NoOperation.Message: The request body submitted contain no data to act upon and no changes to the resource took place.
NoOperation.Resolution: Add properties in the JSON object and resubmit the request.

NoValidSession.Description: The operation did not complete because a valid session is required in order to access resources.
NoValidSession.Message: There is no valid session established with the implementation.
NoValidSession.Resolution: Establish a session before attempting any operations.

PropertyDuplicate.Description: A duplicate property is in the request body.
PropertyDuplicate.Message: The property %1 is duplicated in the request.
PropertyDuplicate.Resolution: If the operation did not complete, remove the duplicate property from the request body and resubmit the request.

PropertyMissing.Description: The request does not include a required property.
PropertyMissing.Message: The property %1 is a required property and must be included in the request.
PropertyMissing.Resolution: If the operation did not complete, verify the property is in the request body and has a valid value.

PropertyNotWritable.Description: The request included a value for a read-only property.
PropertyNotWritable.Message: The property %1 is a read-only property and cannot be assigned a value.
PropertyNotWritable.Resolution: If the operation did not complete, remove the property from the request body and resubmit the request.

PropertyUnknown.Description: An unknown property is in the request body.
PropertyUnknown.Message: The property %1 is not valid for this resource.
PropertyUnknown.Resolution: If the operation did not complete, remove the unknown property from the request body and resubmit the request.

PropertyValueFormatError.Description: The value type is correct, but the format is not supported or the size/length is exceeded.
PropertyValueFormatError.Message: The value %1 for the property %2 is in a format that is not supported by the property.
PropertyValueFormatError.Resolution: If the operation did not complete, correct the property value in the request body and resubmit the request.

PropertyValueModified.Description: Indicates that a property was given the correct value type but the value of that property was modified.  Examples are truncated or rounded values.
PropertyValueModified.Message: The property %1 was assigned the value %2 due to modification by the service.

PropertyValueNotInList.Description: The value type is correct, but the value is not supported.
PropertyValueNotInList.Message: The value %1 for the property %2 is not valid.
PropertyValueNotInList.Resolution: If the operation did not complete, choose a value from the enumeration list and resubmit your request.

PropertyValueTypeError.Description: The property value contains an incorrect property type. For example, a number value for a string property type.
PropertyValueTypeError.Message: The value %1 for the property %2 is the incorrect property type.
PropertyValueTypeError.Resolution: If the operation did not complete, correct the property value in the request body and resubmit the request.

QueryNotSupported.Description: The query is not supported by the implementation.
QueryNotSupported.Message: Querying is not supported by the implementation.
QueryNotSupported.Resolution: If the operation did not complete, remove the query parameter and resubmit the request.

QueryNotSupportedOnResource.Description: The query is not supported on the resource. For example, a start/count query is attempted on a resource that is not a collection.
QueryNotSupportedOnResource.Message: Querying is not supported on the requested resource.
QueryNotSupportedOnResource.Resolution: If the operation did not complete, remove the query parameters and resubmit the request.

QueryParameterOutOfRange.Description: The query parameter value is out of range for the resource. For example, a page is requested that is outside the valid page range.
QueryParameterOutOfRange.Message: The value %1 for the query parameter %2 is out of range %3.
QueryParameterOutOfRange.Resolution: Specify a query parameter value that is within range. For example, a page that is within the valid range of pages.

QueryParameterValueError.Description: Indicates that a query parameter was given an invalid value.
QueryParameterValueError.LongDescription: This message shall be used to indicate that a query parameter was given an invalid value that can not or should not be included in the message.
QueryParameterValueError.Message: The value for the parameter %1 is invalid.
ArgLongDescriptions: This argument shall contain the name of the query parameter.
QueryParameterValueError.Resolution: Correct the value for the query parameter in the request and resubmit the request if the operation failed.

QueryParameterValueFormatError.Description: The value type is correct, but the format is not supported or the size/length was exceeded.
QueryParameterValueFormatError.Message: The value %1 for the parameter %2 is in a format that is not supported by the parameter.
QueryParameterValueFormatError.Resolution: If the operation did not complete, correct the value for the query parameter in the request body and resubmit the request.

QueryParameterValueTypeError.Description: The query parameter contains an incorrect value type. For example, a number supplied for a query parameter that requires a string.
QueryParameterValueTypeError.Message: The value %1 for the query parameter %2 is the incorrect type of value for the query parameter.
QueryParameterValueTypeError.Resolution: If the operation did not complete, correct the value for the query parameter in the request body and resubmit the request.

ResourceAlreadyExists.Description: Indicates that a resource change or creation was attempted but that the operation cannot proceed because the resource already exists.
ResourceAlreadyExists.Message: The requested resource of type %1 with the property %2 with the value %3 already exists.
ResourceAlreadyExists.Resolution: Do not repeat the create operation as the resource has already been created.

ResourceNotFound.Description: Indicates that the operation expected a resource identifier that corresponds to an existing resource but one was not found.
ResourceNotFound.Message: The requested resource of type %1 named %2 was not found.
ResourceNotFound.Resolution: Provide a valid resource identifier and resubmit the request.

ResourceAtUriInUnknownFormat.Description: The URI is valid, but the resource or image at that URI is in a format that is not supported by the service.
ResourceAtUriInUnknownFormat.Message: The resource at %1 is in a format that is not supported by the service.
ResourceAtUriInUnknownFormat.Resolution: Place a resource, image, or file that is supported by the service at the URI.

ResourceAtUriUnauthorized.Description: An attempt to access the resource, image, or file at the URI is unauthorized.
ResourceAtUriUnauthorized.Message: While accessing the resource at %1, the service received an authorization error %2.
ResourceAtUriUnauthorized.Resolution: Verify that the appropriate access is provided for the service to access the URI.

ResourceCannotBeDeleted.Description: A delete operation was attempted on a resource that cannot be deleted.
ResourceCannotBeDeleted.Message: The delete request did not complete because the resource cannot be deleted.
ResourceCannotBeDeleted.Resolution: Do not attempt to delete a resource that does not support the REST API DELETE operation.

ResourceExhaustion.Description: Indicates that a resource could not satisfy the request due to some unavailability of resources.  An example is that available capacity has been allocated.
ResourceExhaustion.Message: The resource %1 was unable to satisfy the request due to unavailability of resources.
ResourceExhaustion.Resolution: Ensure that the resources are available and resubmit the request.

ResourceInStandby.Description: Indicates that the request could not be performed because the resource is in standby.
ResourceInStandby.Message: The request could not be performed because the resource is in standby.
ResourceInStandby.Resolution: Ensure that the resource is in the correct power state and resubmit the request.

ResourceInUse.Description: The request to change the resource was rejected because the resource was in use or in transition.
ResourceInUse.Message: The change to the resource did not complete because the resource is in use or in transition.
ResourceInUse.Resolution: If the operation did not complete, wait until the resource is free and resubmit the request.

ResourceMissingAtURI.Description: The operation expected an image or resource at the provided URI, but found none.
ResourceMissingAtURI.Message: The resource at the URI %1 was not found.
ResourceMissingAtURI.Resolution: Place a valid resource at the URI or correct the URI and resubmit the request.

ResourceTypeIncompatible.Description: Indicates that the resource type of the operation does not match that for the operation destination.  Examples of when this can happen include during a POST to a collection using the wrong resource type, an update where the @odata.types do not match or on a major version incompatability.
ResourceTypeIncompatible.Message: The @odata.type of the request body %1 is incompatible with the @odata.type of the resource which is %2.
ResourceTypeIncompatible.Resolution: Resubmit the request with a payload compatible with the resource's schema.

ServiceInUnknownState.Description: The operation did not complete because the service is in an unknown state and cannot take incoming requests.
ServiceInUnknownState.Message: The operation did not complete because the service is in an unknown state and cannot take incoming requests.
ServiceInUnknownState.Resolution: If the operation did not complete, restart the service and resubmit the request.

ServiceShuttingDown.Description: The operation did not complete because the service is shutting down.
ServiceShuttingDown.Message: The operation did not complete because the service is shutting down and cannot take incoming requests.
ServiceShuttingDown.Resolution: If the operation did not complete, resubmit the request when the service is available.

ServiceTemporarilyUnavailable.Message: The service is temporarily unavailable.  Retry in %1 seconds.
ServiceTemporarilyUnavailable.Resolution: Wait for the indicated retry duration and retry the operation.

SessionLimitExceeded.Description: Session establishment has been requested, but the operation did not complete because the number of simultaneous sessions exceeded the maximum number allowed by the implementation.
SessionLimitExceeded.Message: The session establishment did not complete because the number of simultaneous sessions exceeded the maximum number allowed by the implementation.
SessionLimitExceeded.Resolution: Before attempting to establish the session, reduce the number of sessions or increase the maximum number of simultaneous sessions allowed (if supported).

SessionTerminated.Description: Indicates that the DELETE operation on the Session resource resulted in the successful termination of the session.

SourceDoesNotSupportProtocol.Description: While attempting to access, connect to, or transfer from another location, the other end of the connection did not support the specified protocol.
SourceDoesNotSupportProtocol.Message: The other end of the connection at %1 does not support the specified protocol %2.

StringValueTooLong.Description: Indicates that a string value passed to the given resource exceeded its length limit. An example is when a shorter limit is imposed by an implementation than that allowed by the specification.
StringValueTooLong.Message: The string %1 exceeds the length limit %2.
StringValueTooLong.Resolution: Resubmit the request with an appropriate string length.

UnrecognizedRequestBody.Description: The service detected a request body with malformed JSON.
UnrecognizedRequestBody.Message: The service detected a request body with malformed JSON.
UnrecognizedRequestBody.Resolution: If the operation did not complete, correct the request body and resubmit the request.

AuthenticationTokenRequired.Description: Indicates that the request could not be performed because an authentication token was not provided.
AuthenticationTokenRequired.LongDescription: This message shall be used to indicate that the request could not be performed because the user provided in the request requires multifactor authentication and an authentication token was not provided.
AuthenticationTokenRequired.Message: The request could not be performed because an authentication token was not provided.
AuthenticationTokenRequired.Resolution: Obtain an authentication token and resubmit the request.

OneTimePasscodeSent.Description: Indicates that a required one-time passcode has been sent to the user.  The code should be provided as the `Token` in the request to create a Session.
OneTimePasscodeSent.LongDescription: This message shall be used to indicate that a one-time passcode has been generated by the service as the result of a request to create a Session.  The one-time passcode shall be sent to the `OneTimePasscodeDeliveryAddress` associated with account credentials supplied in the request.
OneTimePasscodeSent.Message: A one-time passcode has been sent to: %1  Supply the passcode as the Token in the request to create a Session.
ArgDescriptions: The delivery address for the one-time passcode.
ArgLongDescriptions: This argument shall contain the delivery address for the one-time passcode.  The value should be partially or fully redacted to prevent receipt by unauthorized clients.
OneTimePasscodeSent.Resolution: Obtain the one-time passcode sent to the delivery address and resubmit the request using the passcode as the Token.

Name: Base Message Registry
